name: conclusive

C2 proving that something is true, or ending any doubt: They had conclusive evidence/proof of her guilt. a conclusive argument Opposite
inconclusive

(of facts, proof, or arguments) ending any doubt or uncertainty about a situation: There’s no conclusive evidence that power lines are a health risk.
